void.string:
A recreation of the model Dentate Gyrus from:
Santhakumar V, Aradi I, Soltesz I. Role of mossy fiber sprouting and mossy cell loss in hyperexcitability: a network model of the dentate gyrus incorporating cell types and axonal topography. J Neurophysiol. 2005
Original model scripts obtained from: http://senselab.med.yale.edu/senselab/modeldb/ShowModel.asp?model=51781
Note that this is a 3D recreation of a 1D model which didn't take spatial location into account, and so the network won't look very "biologically realistic". This replicates the topographic strip (Figure 3C) as opposed to the topographic ring in the downloaded script file. This project illustrates reuse of the existing mod files to create channel mechanisms, and so can only be run on NEURON at this time.
A number of the channel mechanisms are covered by the scope of ChannelML and behaviour of a simple cell incorporating these channels can be seen in the Test and TestNG Simulation Configurations (needs further work!). Further expansion of the scope of ChannelML should allow the full model to be run on GENESIS also.
Some open issues: Is there a PP HIPP synapse? None in file from Modeldb Paper: 1:1 GC to BC divergence, 1:2 in RI10sp.hoc RI10sp.hoc: line 1108, 1 instead of 10? Max allowed electrotonic length of 0.21 is probably too long...

This is the default configuration of the network, with 500 granule cells, 15 mossy cells, 6 basket cells and 6 HIPP cells and no sprouting. Takes 1-2 mins to generate network. By default, plots of cell activity and a 3D view are shown. To speed up the simulation, hide these by selecting No GUI mode when generating the NEURON code

10% Sprouting case. Takes 1-2 mins to generate network. By default, plots of cell activity and a 3D view are shown. To speed up the simulation, hide these by selecting No GUI mode when generating the NEURON code
Compares a simple cell with a number of the original mod files and a cell whose channels have been implemented in ChannelML. This Simulation configuration only runs on NEURON.
This Sim Config contains the cell with only ChannelML based channels and so can be run on both NEURON and GENESIS
